title: Windows GUI is event based. After we create a window, we need to run event loop which ensures processing of window messages:

inline_content.Text: Windows GUI is event based. After we create a window, we need to run event loop which ensures processing of window messages:

title: Event loop finishes when the user closes the window.

inline_content.Text: Event loop finishes when the user closes the window.

title: Further execution of program logic happens as a result of responding to events generated by the user interacting with the widgets.

title: Thread-safe access to widget via synchronization

inline_content.Text: Thread-safe access to widget via synchronization

title: On Windows only the thread that created a given window / control can safely operate on this window / control. In most cases it's the main thread of the application, called UI thread.

inline_content.Text: On Windows only the thread that created a given window / control can safely operate on this window / control. In most cases it's the main thread of the application, called UI thread.

title: Walk inherits this limitation. Calling any method on a widget needs to be done on UI thread. If the code runs in a goroutine and manipulates widgets, it must be executed on the right thread. Use
widget.Synchronize(fn)
c
to schedule arbitrary function to  be executed on UI thread.

inline_content.Text: Walk inherits this limitation. Calling any method on a widget needs to be done on UI thread. If the code runs in a goroutine and manipulates widgets, it must be executed on the right thread. Use
to schedule arbitrary function to  be executed on UI thread.

title: Crashes are often a result of not observing that rule.

inline_content.Text: Crashes are often a result of not observing that rule.
